meanings.definition: In a very beautiful or delicate way.
meanings.sent1: The flowers were arranged exquisitely in the vase.
meanings.sent2: She painted the landscape exquisitely, capturing every detail.
meanings.sent3: The chef exquisitely placed a tiny edible flower on top of the dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her voice flowed exquisitely through the concert hall, enchanting the audience.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky exquisitely with hues of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: In a way that shows extreme skill or sensitivity.
meanings.sent1: The artist exquisitely blended colors to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: He played the piano exquisitely, moving the audience to tears.
meanings.sent3: The detective exquisitely solved the mystery in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her words cut through the silence exquisitely, leaving everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved exquisitely across the stage, captivating all who watched.

meanings.definition: To an extreme degree or extent.
meanings.sent1: She exquisitely understood the complexity of the situation.
meanings.sent2: The team exquisitely executed the plan, achieving great success.
meanings.sent3: The cat exquisitely napped in the warm sunbeam all afternoon.
meanings.sent4: His intelligence shone exquisitely during the challenging exam.
meanings.sent5: The storm raged exquisitely, shaking the entire house with its power.
